intro: Noronhia greeniana, commonly known as the greeniana hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often covered in a fine layer of soft hair. Noronhia greeniana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks.
